data.title: Corum Group
data.text:
EchoStar Communications is acquiring Sling Media

EchoStar Communications Corporation has agreed to acquire Sling Media, Inc., a privately held digital lifestyle products company. EchoStar, through its DISH Network, is the third largest pay-TV provider in the United States. Established in 2004, Sling Media has been a leading innovator in the digital lifestyle space through the introduction of the internationally acclaimed, Emmy award-winning Slingbox and SlingPlayer software. Sling Media's product line is distributed in over 5,000 retail stores in 11 countries. As an early investor in Sling Media, EchoStar has been pleased with the progress and commitment the company has made establishing Sling Media and Slingbox as powerful and beloved digital media brands. With today's increasingly mobile lifestyle, EchoStar's acquisition of Sling Media will allow it to offer innovative and convenient ways for its customers to enjoy their programming on more displays and locations.

Announcement Date: September 24, 2007

Deal Value: $380 million (Cash and options)

ARC acquires Alarity Corporation

ARC International has acquired Alarity Corporation, a privately held multimedia company that has a renowned team of close to 40 personnel based in St. Petersburg, Russia specializing in codec software, firmware, and advanced multimedia architectures. The acquisition includes all of Alarity's employees and its vast library of optimized solutions for standard definition (SD) and HD video, hi-fidelity audio, imaging, DSP, and information security applications. Alarity's development team already plays a key role in select engagements with "Tier 1" customers creating multimedia solutions based upon ARC's configurable processors and subsystems. The acquisition will make available Alarity's full set of resources to a broader number of ARC customers and prospects, enhance ARC's ongoing multimedia product development efforts, and bolster its customer-specific engineering capabilities.

Announcement Date: September 24, 2007

Deal Value: $4.1 million (Cash plus potential two-year earnout of $1.8 million)

Thomson SA acquired SyncCast Corp

Thomson SA acquired SyncCast Corp, a developer of software for delivering digital content and related data. SyncCast delivers content including movies and music to online retailers in addition to Microsoft Corp's Xbox Live Video Marketplace. The acquisition will help Thomson's Technicolor division bolster its offerings in consumer-targeted businesses. Thomson's acquisition coincides with the launch by Technicolor of an end-to-end system to cut the time and steps required to prepare movies, television shows and other content for distribution.

Announcement Date: September 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Hi-Media Group to acquire Fotolog

Hi-Media Group announced that it is acquiring Fotolog, Inc., positioning Hi-Media as a major global online media player by bringing together Hi-Medias extensive ad network and micro-payments business. Launched in May 2002, New York-based Fotolog is a leading social network that provides a platform for members to share experiences and connect with others across the globe through daily photo postings or photologs. Fotologs rapidly growing and highly engaged audience of over 10 million member accounts. Hi-Media believes that it can benefit substantially from Fotologs efforts to generate maximum revenues from its audience thanks to the advertising and micro-payment services that Hi-Media has developed over the past decade. As a result of the transaction, Hi-Media would become one of Europes leading online publishers and one of its largest publicly traded Internet pure plays.

Announcement Date: August 27, 2007

Deal Value: $90 Million (Cash and stock)

Dell is acquiring ZING Systems

Dell announced it intends to acquire privately held ZING Systems Inc., a consumer technology and services company that focuses on always-connected audio and entertainment devices. In a move that reflects the renewed interest and energy being directed at its consumer business, Dell plans to use ZING and its capabilities to continue improving the entertainment experiences it provides its customers.

Announcement Date: August 6, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Autodesk to acquire Skymatter

Autodesk, Inc. is acquiring the assets of Skymatter Limited, developer of Mudbox 3D modeling software. Skymatter's Mudbox software offers a new paradigm of 3D brush-based modeling, allowing users to sculpt organic shapes in 3D space with brush-like tools. Appealing to both traditional sculptors and digital artists, Mudbox provides a simple and fast toolset for creative modeling, prototyping and detailing. This acquisition will augment Autodesk's offering for the film, television and game market segments, while providing additional growth opportunities for other design disciplines.

Announcement Date: August 6, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

NetNetNet.tv to acquire InciteMedia

Netnetnet.tv is acquiring InciteMedia AG (Switzerland), provider of a complete end-to-end digital media management solution that influences the purchasing decisions of active consumers. InciteMedia specializes in both Customer Relationship Management and Digital Asset Management across a number of media platforms. InciteMedia's digital media management and content delivery technology will help Netnetnet.tvs strategy to become the premier out-of-home advertising medium that enables its clients to deliver the right message to the right audience at the right time.

Announcement Date: July 23, 2007
